info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 3:19PM PDT until July 31 at 4:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Nye County in south central Nevada... Western Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 430 PM PDT. * At 319 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain in the Pahrump area. Flash flooding is ongoing in several locations in Pahrump including Highway 160 and several other roads in Pahrump. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pahrump and Highway 160. Heavy rain has mostly ended but ongoing flooding reported by emergency management continues in and around the Pahrump area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
